bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 110 (Tuesday, June 27, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SHEA-PORTER:H.R. 3064.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:ARTICLE I, SECTION 8.[Page H5232]

item.title: Contingency Operation Waste and Fraud Prevention Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

summary.text:
Contingency Operation Waste and Fraud Prevention Act

This bill requires the Department of Defense (DOD) to submit to Congress a strategy to prevent corruption in any reconstruction efforts associated with a military operation. It also establishes the position of Senior Anticorruption Officer in DOD, the Department of State, and the U.S. Agency for International Development, and a Working Group for Anticorruption.

bill.title: Contingency Operation Waste and Fraud Prevention Act

item.title: Contingency Operation Waste and Fraud Prevention Act

To develop an anticorruption strategy, establish Offices for Anticorruption in the Department of Defense, Department of State, and United States Agency for International Development, and for other purposes.
Contingency Operation Waste and Fraud Prevention Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
